items.content_html: As indicated by https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/, NodeJS v12 is no longer in maintenance LTS.
items.title: NodeJS v12 is no longer LTS

items.content_html:
DOMException (and other errors) is serialisable in the current HTML spec: whatwg/html#4665.

  • Support was added in Chrome 77 - https://chromestatus.com/feature/5745988251680768
  • Support was added in FF101 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1561357

What this PR does is add a "negative subfeature", which is something Daniel suggested for spec updates that change old behaviour. Rather than saying "X supports serialisation from this version" it says "X does supports not_serialisation from first version to version removed". The theory is that after a time you can remove the subfeature and just have the assumption everything supports serialisation.

Anyway, that's what I did for this. The only one I am not sure how to get is deno.

IFF you are OK with this approach we can merge and I will update the other serializable errors that are supported by chrome (but not by firefox): Error, EvalError, RangeError, ReferenceError, SyntaxError, TypeError, and URIError.

Other associated docs work in mdn/content#15638
items.title: DOMException is serialisable

items.content_html: This PR removes the now-irrelevant notes for Firefox Android and WebView Android regarding availability of MediaDevices.getUserMedia(). The method was removed entirely in Chromium 88 and Firefox Android 79, so it isn't separated into multiple support statements to reflect the method's history (especially since it always rejected). Fixes #8821.
items.title: Remove irrelevant notes for api.MediaDevices.getDisplayMedia
